name: St. Paul of the Cross
summary: Paul of the Cross was an Italian mystic and the founder of the Passionists, a religious order dedicated to preaching about the Passion of Christ. He received visions and experienced mystical phenomena throughout his life. He established the first Passionist monastery in 1737 and spent his life preaching missions and retreats throughout Italy, emphasizing the love of God shown through Christ's suffering.
keyQuotes: It is very good and holy to consider the passion of our Lord and to meditate on it, for by this sacred path we reach union with God.
